授業目的: 本授業の目的は、社会・ビジネス問題に関するディスカッションで自己の意見を明確かつ効果的に述べ、さらに自信を持って内容を掘り下げた比較的長いスピーチ、プレゼンテーションをするために必要なスキル、言語能力、テクニックを身に着けることである。
到達目標: 授業において修得したスキル、言語、テクニックを生かし、社会・ビジネス問題を含む様々なトピックに関するディスカッションで自在に自己の意見を述べ、かつ内容を掘り下げた比較的長いスピーチ・プレゼンテーションができるようになることを目指す。
特記事項:
本授業科目は、“オンライン授業60単位制限対象科目”ではありません。 The course is not subject to the 60-credit limit for online courses.
【合併】English Public Speaking B（総合政策学部）/英語パブリック・スピーキングＢ（総合政策学部）
関連科目: 英語パブリックスピーキングＡ
授業方法:
This course will be conducted in English only and English will be the means of communication between the students and the instructor.
There will be some lecturing but students will spend a lot of time working individually, in pairs and in groups. Students will be making speeches and presentations several times during the semester.
In principle, students are required to attend face to face class sessions.
If you have any question, send messages to the email address posted in [お知らせ］in LUNA; write your student ID number and name and the course title.
【for those who are permitted to take the class online】
Class materials (documents and power point files, etc.) will be provided through LUNA.
The class material for each session will be posted in [教材・課題］section on the day after each session

第1回:
All the sessions will be conducted face to face.
Course Description
Warm Up Activities
トピック.授業計画1: Some of the class time will be spent reviewing the skills, language and techniques for effective speeches and presentations that students learned in the previous course and learning new ones.  Students will also spend some time giving news reports.  Students will have plenty of opportunities to have discussions and practice organizing and making public speeches during the term.
トピック.授業外学習2:
Students will be expected to spend one to two hours outside the class preparing for each lesson, doing assignments, doing some research and writing on given topics or topics of their choice.
Writing assignments will be returned after checking and making necessary corrections.
Criteria for the speech evaluation will be given beforehand.

評価.学生による授業評価の方法Course Evaluation by Student: Students will independently evaluate the course and the instructor at the end of the semester.
